recipe: Jumbo sausage roll with salsa beans
name: Jumbo sausage roll with salsa beans

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g potato, peeled and chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion, roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"340g can corned beef, cut into cubes"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp Worcestershire sauce"},{"ingredients":"baked beans and a little curly parsley, roughly chopped, to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the potatoes in a pan, cover with cold water and bring to the boil. Cook for about 6-7 mins, then drain."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a non-stick frying pan and cook the onion for 3-4 mins over a medium heat. Add the potatoes and corned beef, and push down with a spatula to crisp up, cooking for about 5 mins. Turn the mixture over, trying not to break up the meat and potatoes too much, then add the Worcestershire sauce. Cook for another 5 mins, pushing down to crisp the base again. Season a little, then serve with baked beans and a sprinkling of parsley, if you like."}]

recipe: Sweet potato & sprout hash with poached eggs
name: Sweet potato & sprout hash with poached eggs

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"drizzle of oil"},{"ingredients":"1 small onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , crushed"},{"ingredients":"250g beef mince"},{"ingredients":"1 potato , cut into 1cm/0.5in cubes"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp turmeric"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp tomato purée"},{"ingredients":"few thyme sprigs"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp hot pepper sauce"},{"ingredients":"500g block shortcrust pastry"},{"ingredients":"1 egg , beaten"},{"ingredients":"green salad , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a pan, add the onion and cook for 5 mins. Add the garlic and beef, turn up the heat and cook until the meat is browned. Add the potato, half the turmeric, the purée and thyme, plus 200ml water. Cover and simmer for 15 mins, then remove the lid and cook for 5 mins more. Add the hot pepper sauce and leave to cool."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7. Roll out the pastry to the thickness of a £1 coin. Cut out 6 x 15cm circles, using a small plate as a guide. Divide the mince between the circles, piling it up on one side. Mix the egg with the remaining turmeric, brush around the edge of each circle, then fold over and use a fork to seal the edges. Arrange on a baking tray lined with baking parchment, brush with a little more egg and bake for 20-25 mins. Serve with a green salad."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp rapeseed oil"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp chipotle paste"},{"ingredients":"1½ tbsp honey"},{"ingredients":"8 chicken drumsticks"},{"ingredients":"1 lime , zested and juiced"},{"ingredients":"1 small avocado , stoned"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp fat-free Greek yogurt"},{"ingredients":"125g each red and white cabbage , both shredded"},{"ingredients":"1 large carrot , cut into matchsticks"},{"ingredients":"3 spring onions , sliced"},{"ingredients":"4 corn on the cobs , steamed, to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Whisk the oil, chipotle paste and honey together in a large bowl. Add the chicken and toss to coat, then spread out on a non-stick baking tray. Roast for 30 mins, turning halfway through."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put the lime zest and juice, avocado flesh, yogurt and a good pinch of salt into a blender and blitz until completely smooth. Put the sauce in a large bowl with the cabbage, carrot and spring onion and toss to combine."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Serve the drumsticks with the slaw and steamed corn, if you like."}]

recipe: Sticky chicken drumsticks & sesame rice salad
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 chicken drumsticks"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp clear honey , plus 1tsp"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp tamari (or soy sauce if not gluten free)"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp sesame oil"},{"ingredients":"120g basmati rice"},{"ingredients":"70g kale , chopped"},{"ingredients":"juice 2 limes"},{"ingredients":"100g radishes , halved"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp sesame seeds"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Put the drumsticks in a roasting tin. Mix 2 tbsp honey, the tamari, 1 tbsp veg oil and 1 tbsp sesame oil in a bowl, then pour over the chicken – make sure each piece is covered. Roast for 25-30 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, cover the rice with 240ml water and bring to the boil. Cook for 8-10 mins until tender. Massage the kale with 1 tbsp veg oil for 5 mins until softening (this makes it less chewy). Drizzle over the lime juice, remaining sesame oil and honey, and season. Add the radishes and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Fry the rice in the remaining veg oil in a non-stick pan to dry out. Add to the kale, and toss to combine."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Serve the drumsticks with the salad and scatter over the sesame seeds."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"1 red or white onion, or 4 spring onions, chopped"},{"ingredients":"400g mixed vegetables of your choice (we used carrots, red pepper and sweetcorn)"},{"ingredients":"200g leftover chicken, chopped into small chunks"},{"ingredients":"2 x 250g packs ready-cooked lime & coriander rice"},{"ingredients":"400g can  red kidney beans in chilli sauce"},{"ingredients":"6 large wraps"},{"ingredients":"1 avocado, chopped"},{"ingredients":"100g grated cheddar"},{"ingredients":"1 egg, beaten"},{"ingredients":"soured cream, to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large pan. Add the onion and cook for 5 mins until soft, then add your chosen veggies and continue cooking for another 5-10 mins or until tender. Add the leftover meat, the rice and beans, along with the sauce from the can. Stir everything together and cook for 5 mins until piping hot."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat another frying pan, or a griddle pan, until hot, and heat oven to 140C/120C fan/gas 2. Now assemble the burritos. Warm a wrap for 10 secs on the hot pan (keep the pan hot, you’ll need to use it again)."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Pile roughly a sixth of the rice mixture onto the centre of the wrap. Top with a little avocado and some cheese, then brush beaten egg around the edge. Fold the ends over the filling, then fold in the sides, like an envelope."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Flatten a little to a parcel, then place, seam-side down, in the hot pan. Cook for 2 mins until the underside has sealed shut and is toasted a golden brown, flip over and cook for a few mins more."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Keep the burrito warm in the oven while you continue assembling and cooking the remaining burritos. Serve with soured cream, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"8 chicken thighs, skin on and bone in"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp hoisin sauce"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp sesame oil"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp clear honey"},{"ingredients":"1 ½ tsp Chinese five-spice powder"},{"ingredients":"thumb-sized knob of ginger, grated"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves, grated"},{"ingredients":"bunch spring onions, chopped"},{"ingredients":"50g cashew nuts, toasted"},{"ingredients":"cooked brown rice, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Arrange the chicken thighs in a large roasting tin and slash the skin 2-3 times on each thigh. Mix together the hoisin, sesame oil, honey, five-spice, ginger, garlic and some seasoning. Pour over the chicken and toss to coat – you could now marinate the chicken for 2 hrs, or overnight if you have time. Roast, skin-side up, for 35 mins, basting at least once."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Stir through the cashew nuts and sprinkle the spring onions over the chicken. Return to the oven for 5 mins, then serve with brown rice."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1½ tbsp sesame oil"},{"ingredients":"1 red onion , cut into thin wedges"},{"ingredients":"160g mangetout"},{"ingredients":"70g baby corn , halved"},{"ingredients":"2 baby pak choi , quartered"},{"ingredients":"3 spring onions , sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 large garlic clove , crushed"},{"ingredients":"½ tbsp mild curry powder"},{"ingredients":"4 tsp low-salt soy sauce"},{"ingredients":"300g ready-to-cook udon noodles"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp pickled sushi ginger , chopped, plus 2 tbsp of the brine"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a non-stick frying pan or wok over a high heat. Add the onion and fry for 5 mins. Stir in the mangetout, corn, pak choi and spring onions and cook for 5 mins more. Add the garlic, curry powder and soy sauce, and cook for another minute."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the udon noodles along with the ginger and reserved brine, and stir in 2-3 tbsp hot water until the noodles are heated through. Divide between bowls and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 tbsp chilli sauce , or to taste (not to be confused with sweet chilli sauce or hot sauce, such as Tabasco; we used Lingham’s, which is mild, sweet and spicy)"},{"ingredients":"100g natural yogurt"},{"ingredients":"2 x 225g packs paneer , each cut into 10 cubes"},{"ingredients":"100g pack sesame seeds"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp sunflower oil"},{"ingredients":"1 carrot , peeled and grated"},{"ingredients":"½ cucumber , halved, deseeded and sliced into batons"},{"ingredients":"2 Baby Gem lettuces , shredded"},{"ingredients":"4 tortillas wraps, warmed following pack instructions"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Mix 1 tsp of the chilli sauce with the yogurt and some seasoning, and set side. Brush the paneer cubes with the remaining chilli sauce and roll each cube in the sesame seeds."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat and fry the paneer in batches for 5-8 mins or until golden all over. Turn the cubes frequently, as the seeds can catch easily. Drain on kitchen paper, then serve with the chilli yogurt, carrot, cucumber, lettuce and warm wraps."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g milk or dark chocolate with coffee, broken into chunks"},{"ingredients":"300ml pot double cream"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp crème fraîche"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Melt the chocolate in the microwave for 2 mins, stirring halfway through, or over a pan of gently simmering water. Leave to cool a little."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Using an electric whisk, whip the double cream with the vanilla in a bowl until lightly whipped. Fold in the cooled, melted chocolate until fully combined."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Split the mixture between four small bowls or ramekins and serve topped with a dollop of crème fraîche. If you aren’t serving straight away, chill in the fridge and then add the crème fraîche just before bringing to the table."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"400g gnocchi"},{"ingredients":"200g chargrilled vegetables (from the deli counter - I used chargrilled peppers, aubergines, artichokes and semi-dried tomatoes)"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp red pesto"},{"ingredients":"a handful of basil leaves"},{"ingredients":"parmesan or pecorino (or vegetarian alternative), to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Boil a large pan of salted water. Add the gnocchi, cook for 2 mins or until it rises to the surface, then drain and tip back into the pan with a splash of reserved cooking water."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the chargrilled veg, chopped into pieces if large, red pesto and basil leaves. Serve with shavings of Parmesan or pecorino (or vegetarian alternative)."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g pack ciabatta bread mix"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp red pesto"},{"ingredients":"½ red onion , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"50g green beans , trimmed and halved"},{"ingredients":"100g brie , sliced into strips"},{"ingredients":"6 anchovies"},{"ingredients":"8 black pitted olives , halved"},{"ingredients":"handful basil leaves"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7. Put a large baking sheet, about 38 x 28cm, in the oven to heat up. Make up the bread mix following pack instructions. Roll out the dough on a large sheet of baking parchment to a rough rectangle of about 35 x 25cm."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Spread the pesto over the dough, then scatter on the red onions. In a chevron pattern, arrange the beans and cheese over the top. Add the anchovies along the middle and dot with the olives. Put the pizza, on the baking parchment, onto the hot baking sheet. Turn the oven down to 200C/180C fan/gas 6 and bake for 15-18 mins. Scatter with basil leaves just before serving."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"8 skinless boneless chicken thighs, cut into chunks"},{"ingredients":"1 onion,  finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 garlic cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"2 red chillies, finely sliced (deseeded if you don't like it too hot)"},{"ingredients":"2tsp fresh ginger, grated"},{"ingredients":"2tbsp garam masala"},{"ingredients":"100g smooth peanut butter"},{"ingredients":"400ml coconut milk"},{"ingredients":"400g can chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"coriander , ½ roughly chopped, ½ leaves picked"},{"ingredients":"roasted peanuts, to serve"},{"ingredients":"cooked basmati rice, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat 1 tbsp of the oil in a deep frying pan over a medium heat. Brown the chicken in batches, setting aside once golden. Fry the onion for 8 minutes until softened. Then add the garlic, chilli and ginger and fry in the other 1 tbsp oil for 1 min. Add the garam masala and fry for 1 min more."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Stir in the peanut butter, coconut milk and tomatoes, and bring to a simmer. Return the chicken to the pan and add the chopped coriander. Cook for 30 mins until the sauce thickens and the chicken is cooked through."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Serve with the remaining coriander, roasted peanuts and rice, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"325g can  sweetcorn"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp mild curry powder"},{"ingredients":"1 garlic clove , crushed"},{"ingredients":"1 x 50 sachet  creamed coconut , chopped"},{"ingredients":"4 frozen  smoked haddock fillets"},{"ingredients":"cooked rice , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"In a blender, whizz the sweetcorn, along with any liquid from the can, into a rough purée and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large lidded frying pan and cook the onion for 2-3 mins to soften. Add the curry powder and garlic and cook for 1 min more until fragrant."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Tip the creamed coconut into the pan with 300ml water, stirring until the creamed coconut dissolves. Add the puréed sweetcorn and bring to the boil. Place the haddock fillets in the sauce, then reduce the heat to a simmer. Cover and cook for 20 mins, or until the fish is cooked through. Season and serve with rice."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 parsnips , peeled and cut into wedges"},{"ingredients":"4 carrots , cut into wedges"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp cumin seeds"},{"ingredients":"400g can chickpeas , drained"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"500g pack cooked beetroot (not in vinegar), drained and cut into wedges"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp clear honey"},{"ingredients":"200g pot hummus"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp white wine vinegar"},{"ingredients":"small bunch mint , leaves picked"},{"ingredients":"200g block Greek-style salad cheese or feta"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Toss the parsnips, carrots, cumin seeds and chickpeas with the oil and some seasoning in a large roasting tin. Cook for 30 mins, tossing halfway through cooking."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the beetroot to the tin and drizzle over the honey, then return to the oven for 10 mins. Spread the hummus thinly over a large platter, or divide between 4 dinner plates. When the veg is ready, drizzle with the vinegar and toss together in the tin. Tip the roasted vegetables on top of the hummus, scatter over the mint and cheese, drizzle with any juices from the tin and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"225 chorizo ring, sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 onion, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 garlic clove, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"300g pearl barley"},{"ingredients":"400g can chopped tomato with sliced olives"},{"ingredients":"1l hot chicken stock, made with 1 stock cube"},{"ingredients":"2 stalks rosemary, leaves chopped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat a non-stick frying pan over a medium heat and fry the chorizo for 3-4 mins until it turns golden and releases its oil. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the onion and garlic to the pan, and cook for 3-4 mins, until they begin to soften. Add the pearl barley and stir well to coat in the oil, before tipping in the chopped tomatoes and the chicken stock. Bring just to the boil, then turn down to a simmer and cook for 30 mins, stirring occasionally, until all the liquid has been absorbed and the pearl barley is tender. You may need to top up with a little extra water as you go."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Season and stir in the rosemary and chorizo to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"400g lean pork shoulder, cut into 2cm chunks"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"½ tbsp dried oregano"},{"ingredients":"1 lemon , zested and juiced"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp hot paprika"},{"ingredients":"100ml fat-free yogurt"},{"ingredients":"1 small garlic clove , grated"},{"ingredients":"½ cucumber , trimmed and grated"},{"ingredients":"2 red peppers , deseeded and cut into chunks"},{"ingredients":"2 Little Gem lettuce , leaves separated"},{"ingredients":"chilli sauce , to serve (optional)"},{"ingredients":"flatbreads , warmed, to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the pork in a large bowl with the oil, oregano, lemon zest and juice and paprika as well as a good pinch of salt. Toss everything together to combine and leave to marinate for 10 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Combine the yogurt, garlic and cucumber together in a bowl. Season with salt and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat the grill to high. Thread the marinated pork and the peppers on four metal skewers, alternating between the pork and peppers as you go. Place on a non-stick baking sheet and grill for 3-4 mins on each side, or until cooked through and golden brown."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Serve with the lettuce, yogurt mixture and chilli sauce, and flatbreads, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 fennel bulb , finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 pork sausages"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp fennel seeds , crushed"},{"ingredients":"2 large garlic cloves , crushed"},{"ingredients":"3 thyme sprigs, leaves finely chopped, plus extra to serve"},{"ingredients":"400g risotto rice"},{"ingredients":"100ml white wine"},{"ingredients":"1.4 litres hot chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"70g parmesan , finely grated"},{"ingredients":"1 lemon , zested and juiced"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large saucepan, add the onion and fennel and fry for 10 mins or until softened. Raise the heat. Squeeze the sausagemeat out of the skins straight into the pan and fry for 5 mins, or until turning golden brown. Stir through the fennel seeds, garlic and thyme and fry for a further minute."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Tip in the rice and fry for 1 min. Pour the wine into the pan and boil the liquid until reduced by half. Add half the stock and cook until absorbed, stirring constantly. Add the remaining stock, a ladleful at a time, and cook until al dente and not too thick in consistency, stirring constantly for 20-25 mins. Season with black pepper."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Stir through the cheese and lemon, then spoon into four bowls and scatter over the extra thyme leaves to finish."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"425g can sliced  mango in syrup, drained"},{"ingredients":"200g butter , softened"},{"ingredients":"225g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"4 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"200g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"50g desiccated coconut , plus 3 tbsp for sprinkling"},{"ingredients":"140g Greek-style coconut yogurt"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Grease and line a 20 x 30cm baking tin with 2 strips of criss-crossed baking parchment. Dry the mango pieces on some kitchen paper, then chop into 3cm pieces and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Place the butter and sugar into a bowl, and whisk until smooth and creamy. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Use a spatula to fold through the flour and coconut, then the mango pieces and yogurt. Scrape the mixture into your tin and smooth over the surface, then sprinkle with a little extra coconut. Bake for 30 mins until risen and golden and a skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean. Cool for 10 mins in the tin, then transfer to a wire rack. This cake is delicious served warm with an extra blob of coconut yogurt, or just as good cold. Keeps in a tin for up to 3 days."}]

recipe: Creamy cider & sausage braise with apples & mash
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g Maris Piper or King Edward potatoes , peeled and cut into chunks"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp crème fraîche"},{"ingredients":"knob of  butter"},{"ingredients":"½ tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 apples , cored and each cut into 12 wedges"},{"ingredients":"8 sausages"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , sliced"},{"ingredients":"500ml medium-dry  cider"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp English mustard"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the potatoes in a large pan, cover with water and bring to the boil. Cook for 15-20 mins until tender, then drain and mash with 2 tbsp of the crème fraîche. Season to taste."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"While the potatoes cook, heat the butter and oil in a large lidded frying pan. When the butter is just foaming, add the apple wedges. Cook over a medium heat for about 2 mins each side, or until just turning golden. Remove from the pan with a slotted spoon and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Add the sausages and onion to the pan and cook for 6-7 mins – turn the sausages so that they brown all over, and stir the onion so it doesn’t catch. Pour in the cider and bring to the boil, then cover and cook for 10 mins."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Stir in the mustard, remaining crème fraîche and the apples. Season to taste and serve with the mash."}]

recipe: Pistachio lamb koftas with apricot relish
name: Pistachio lamb koftas with apricot relish

recipe: Jacket potato with whipped feta & sumac
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 baking potato"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp garlic salt"},{"ingredients":"50g feta"},{"ingredients":"50g Greek yogurt"},{"ingredients":"1 roasted red peppers from a jar (about 25g), finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp sumac"},{"ingredients":"few basil leaves , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 220C/200C fan/ gas 6. Prick the potato all over with a fork and bake for 1 hr until it is golden outside and soft inside. Mix 1 tsp olive oil with the garlic salt. Cut a deep cross into the top of the jacket, drizzle the garlic oil into the cross and rub it all over the outside. Return to the oven and bake for 15 mins more until the edges are golden and crispy."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, crumble the feta into a bowl, add the yogurt and whisk together until creamy. Stir in the red pepper with a good grind of black pepper and spoon the whipped feta into the jacket. Sprinkle with the sumac, drizzle over the remaining 1 tsp olive oil and scatter a few torn basil leaves on top, if you like."}]

recipe: Smoked mackerel chowder with hedgehog garlic bread
name: Smoked mackerel chowder with hedgehog garlic bread

recipe: Chicken & cider fricassée with parsley croûtes
name: Chicken & cider fricassée with parsley croûtes

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 baking potatoes"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 large onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"400g pork mince"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp chipotle paste"},{"ingredients":"400g can chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"1 chicken stock cube"},{"ingredients":"300ml pot soured cream"},{"ingredients":"¼ small pack chives , snipped"},{"ingredients":"mixed leaves , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6 and prick the potatoes all over with a fork. Use 1 tbsp of the oil to rub over the potatoes and place on a baking sheet in the oven for about 1 hr until cooked through."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, make the chilli. Put the remaining oil in a deep frying pan over a medium heat. Add the onion and cook for about 10 mins until softened. Add the mince, breaking up with a wooden spoon and stirring until turning pale. Stir through the chipotle paste, cook for 1 min, then tip in the tomatoes, crumble over the stock cube and season well. Cover and simmer over a gentle heat with the lid on for about 40 mins, stirring occasionally."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Remove the lid from the chilli and cook for 10 mins more. Once the potatoes are cooked, halve them and top with the chilli, a dollop of soured cream and a sprinkling of chives. Serve with mixed leaves, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 ½ tsp fennel seeds"},{"ingredients":"500g lamb mince"},{"ingredients":"1 ½ tbsp ras el hanout"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp pine nuts , toasted and roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 x 400g cans chickpeas , drained and rinsed"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp honey"},{"ingredients":"80g Greek yogurt"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp tahini"},{"ingredients":"1 lemon , 1/2 juiced, 1/2 cut into wedges to serve"},{"ingredients":"25g parsley , roughly chopped, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Using a pestle and morter, crush the fennel seeds. In a large bowl, combine the crushed seeds, lamb, ras el hanout and pine nuts, and season well. Divide the mixture into eight equal egg-shaped koftas."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Tip the chickpeas into an ovenproof dish, season to taste and put in the oven while you fry the koftas. Heat 1 tbsp of the oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. Add the koftas and gently fry for 5 mins, turning from time to time, until evenly browned. Remove from the pan with a slotted spoon and set aside on a plate."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Remove the chickpeas from the oven, add the koftas to the dish, then pour over the rest of the oil and the honey, and return to the oven for 15 mins."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"In a bowl, combine the yogurt, tahini and lemon juice with 70-100ml water and season well. Serve the koftas and chickpeas topped with parsley and a good drizzle of the creamy dressing, with the lemon wedges on the side."}]

recipe: Frying pan pizza bianco with mushrooms & egg
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"175g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp oil , plus a drizzle for frying"},{"ingredients":"1 garlic clove , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"4 rosemary sprigs, chopped"},{"ingredients":"140g mushrooms , sliced"},{"ingredients":"85g light cream cheese"},{"ingredients":"1 egg"},{"ingredients":"good pinch of chilli flakes"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"In a large bowl, mix the flour with the oil, 85ml water and a pinch of salt to make a dough. Tip onto the work surface and knead for 1-2 mins to bring together into a smooth ball, then return to the bowl, cover with a tea towel and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat a drizzle of oil in a flameproof frying pan, roughly 22cm wide. Add the garlic and most of the rosemary and sizzle for 1-2 mins until just turning golden. Add the mushrooms and cook for 10 mins or until golden and tender. Season and tip out onto a plate. Shape the dough into a thin disc roughly the same size as your pan – you can do this with your hands, no need to use a rolling pin. Place in the pan and cook for 4-5 mins over a low-medium heat, until the underside is golden. Use a fish slice to flip over, then cook for another 4-5 mins."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat the grill to high. Season the cream cheese and spread over the pizza. Top with the mushrooms, leaving space in the centre for the egg. Crack the egg into the space and season, then place the pan under the grill for 3-4 mins until the white has set but the yolk is still a little runny. Sprinkle with the chilli flakes and remaining rosemary before serving."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 large sweet potatoes , cut into thin wedges"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp rapeseed oil"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp fat-free natural yogurt"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp low-fat mayonnaise"},{"ingredients":"3 cornichons , finely chopped, plus 1 tbsp of the brine"},{"ingredients":"1 shallot , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp finely chopped dill , plus extra to serve"},{"ingredients":"300g frozen peas"},{"ingredients":"50ml milk"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp finely chopped mint"},{"ingredients":"4 cod or pollock loin fillets"},{"ingredients":"1 lemon , cut into wedges, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 8. Toss the sweet potatoes with the oil and some seasoning on a baking tray. Roast for 20 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Combine the yogurt, mayonnaise, cornichons and reserved brine, the shallot and dill with 1 tbsp cold water in a small bowl and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Meanwhile, put the peas in a pan with the milk, bring to a simmer and cook for 5 mins. Blitz the mixture using a hand blender until roughly puréed. Stir in the mint and season to taste. Set aside."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Add the cod or pollock to the baking tray with the sweet potatoes, season and cook for 10-15 mins more, or until cooked through. Warm through the pea mixture. Scatter over some dill and serve the traybake with the yogurt tartare and the mushy peas."}]

recipe: Crispy cod fingers with wedges & dill slaw
name: Crispy cod fingers with wedges & dill slaw

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"1 large red onion , chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 fat garlic cloves , crushed"},{"ingredients":"200g frozen lamb mince"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp curry paste (we used tikka)"},{"ingredients":"400g can chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"2 large potatoes , cut into 2cm/0.75in cubes"},{"ingredients":"250g frozen peas"},{"ingredients":"8 flour wraps or chapatis , warmed"},{"ingredients":"140g natural yogurt"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large pan, add the onion and cook for a few mins to soften. Add the garlic, stir for 1 min, then add the frozen mince. Cook until defrosted and nicely browned, then stir in the curry paste, tomatoes, potatoes and half a can of water. Season well, then cover with a lid and simmer for 20 mins or until the potatoes are nearly cooked."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Remove the lid and simmer for a further 10-15 mins until the liquid has reduced and the sauce clings to the potatoes and mince. Add the peas, stir through until defrosted, then serve with the warm wraps and yogurt."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"300g pasta (we used conchiglie)"},{"ingredients":"1 head of broccoli, cut into small florets"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"250g ham, cut into chunks (get a nice thick slice from the deli counter)"},{"ingredients":"300ml pot double cream"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp English mustard"},{"ingredients":"140g mature cheddar, grated"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Bring a large pan of water to the boil and cook the pasta following pack instructions, adding the broccoli florets to the pan for the final 4 mins. Drain and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, make the sauce. Heat the oil in a large pan and cook the onion for 5 mins to soften, then stir in the garlic and cook for 1 min more. Stir in the ham, cream and mustard, then bring to the boil. Add the pasta and broccoli, then stir in the cheese, coating everything in the sauce."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 garlic bulb"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 large butternut squash , peeled, deseeded and cut into small cubes"},{"ingredients":"350g spaghetti or linguine"},{"ingredients":"small bunch sage , leaves only"},{"ingredients":"100g goat's cheese , crumbled"},{"ingredients":"50g toasted pine nuts"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Cut off the top third of the garlic bulb and discard. Drizzle the garlic with ½ tsp of the oil, season, then wrap in foil. Toss the squash with the remaining oil and some seasoning, then spread over a large, shallow baking tray. Add the garlic parcel to the tray and roast for 30 mins or until the squash is soft and starting to caramelise."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"After 20 mins roasting time, boil the pasta following pack instructions. When the squash is ready, unwrap the garlic and carefully squeeze out the soft cloves. Drain the pasta, toss with the squash, garlic, sage and goat’s cheese. Sprinkle over the pine nuts and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"300g spaghetti"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , crushed"},{"ingredients":"1 red chilli , deseeded and finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp tomato purée"},{"ingredients":"425g can  pilchard in tomato sauce"},{"ingredients":"70g pack dried  black olive with herbs (we used Crespo), roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"shaved parmesan , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Cook the pasta following pack instructions. Heat the oil in a non-stick frying pan and cook the onion, garlic and chilli for 3-4 mins to soften. Stir in the tomato purée and cook for 1 min, then add the pilchards with their sauce. Cook, breaking up the fish with a wooden spoon, then add the olives and continue to cook for a few more mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Drain the pasta and add to the pan with 2-3 tbsp of the cooking water. Toss everything together well, then divide between plates and serve, scattered with Parmesan."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"100g basmati rice"},{"ingredients":"200g green bean , topped and tailed, then halved"},{"ingredients":"1 ½ tbsp sunflower oil"},{"ingredients":"140g pork mince"},{"ingredients":"4 tsp dark soy sauce"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp rice wine"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"¼ tsp Sichuan pepper , lightly crushed using a pestle and mortar"},{"ingredients":"1 red chilli , halved and sliced"},{"ingredients":"4 fat garlic cloves , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 small knob of  ginger , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 spring onions , 2 finely chopped, 1 sliced for garnish"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp sesame oil"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Cook the rice following pack instructions. Boil the beans for 4 mins, then drain under cold water, pat dry and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"In a large non-stick wok or frying pan, heat 1 tbsp of the oil. Add the pork mince and fry for a few mins, breaking up into small pieces with the back of a spoon. Stir in half the soy, the rice wine and sugar and cook for 30 secs more. When the meat is cooked through, tip onto a plate."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat the remaining oil in the pan. Add the pepper, chilli, garlic, ginger and chopped onions, and stir-fry for 2 mins until ginger and garlic are softened. Tip in the beans, heat through, then add the mince – stir-fry for 2 mins until hot. Stir in the rest of the soy and sesame oil. Scatter with spring onions and serve with rice."}]

recipe: Jumbo sausage roll with salsa beans
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"400g sausagemeat , or pack of 8 sausages, squeezed from their skins"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp dried mixed herbs"},{"ingredients":"300g jar hot salsa dip"},{"ingredients":"1 egg , beaten"},{"ingredients":"375g ready-rolled puff pastry sheet"},{"ingredients":"3 x 400g cans cannellini or haricot beans (or a mixture), drained"},{"ingredients":"400g can chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"1 green chilli , thinly sliced (deseeded if you don't like it too hot)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6 and line a baking tray with baking parchment or foil. In a large bowl, mix together the sausagemeat, herbs, half the salsa and roughly half the egg until well combined."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Unroll the pastry sheet on your baking tray. Pile the sausage mixture onto one side of the pastry – along the longer side – leaving a gap of 4cm around the edge. Brush a little of the egg around the edges, then fold the pastry over the filling. Press the edges together with a fork and score a few air holes through the top with a knife (to let steam escape). Brush with the remaining egg and bake for 40 mins."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Meanwhile, tip the beans, tomatoes, remaining salsa and some seasoning into a saucepan and cover with a lid. Simmer for 20 mins or until the sauce is thick and clings to the beans. To serve, scatter the beans with the chilli and serve with slices of sausage roll."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 large garlic cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp chilli flakes (optional)"},{"ingredients":"400g can chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"5 anchovy fillets, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"120g pitted black olives"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp capers, drained"},{"ingredients":"300g dried spaghetti"},{"ingredients":"½ small bunch of parsley, finely chopped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a non-stick pan over a medium-low heat. Add the onion along with a generous pinch of salt and fry for 10 mins, or until soft. Add the garlic and chilli, if using, and cook for a further minute."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Stir the tomatoes, anchovies, olives and capers into the onion, bring to a gentle simmer and cook, uncovered, for 15 mins. Season to taste."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Meanwhile, bring a large pan of salted water to the boil. Cook the spaghetti following pack instructions, then drain and toss with the sauce and parsley."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"25g butter , plus extra for greasing"},{"ingredients":"850ml vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"200g quick-cook polenta"},{"ingredients":"50g parmesan (or vegetarian alternative), grated"},{"ingredients":"2 rosemary sprigs, leaves finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"500g chestnut mushrooms , halved"},{"ingredients":"small bunch thyme , leaves only"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"125g ball mozzarella , drained"},{"ingredients":"large handful rocket"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp balsamic vinegar"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Grease and line a large baking tray with baking parchment. Bring the stock to the boil in a large saucepan, then slowly pour in the polenta, whisking all the time. Bring it to the boil and bubble for 8 mins, whisking continuously. Remove from the heat and stir in the cheese, butter, rosemary and plenty of seasoning. Spread the polenta over the lined tray and bake for 30 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, mix the mushrooms with the thyme and some seasoning. Heat a splash of oil in a large frying pan and fry the mushrooms in a couple of batches until golden. Tear the mozzarella into pieces and pat dry with kitchen paper. Top the baked polenta with the mushrooms and mozzarella, then bake again for 10 mins or until the cheese is melted and bubbling. Scatter the rocket over the tart and drizzle with the balsamic vinegar."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp Cajun seasoning"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"zest and juice 1  lime"},{"ingredients":"750g large  potato , cut into chips"},{"ingredients":"1kg chicken wing"},{"ingredients":"green salad or coleslaw and  ketchup , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. In a bowl, whisk together the Cajun seasoning, vegetable oil, lime zest and juice. Toss the chips, wings and Cajun mixture together in batches, so that everything is well coated."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Cover a large baking sheet with foil, then arrange the chips around the outside and the wings in the middle. Season and bake for 20 mins, then turn the chips and return to the oven for a further 20-25 mins until the chips and wings are golden. Serve with green salad, or coleslaw and ketchup."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50ml olive oil , plus 1 tbsp"},{"ingredients":"2 fennel bulbs , finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 onions , finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"4 garlic cloves , crushed"},{"ingredients":"2 red chillies , deseeded and finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp tomato purée"},{"ingredients":"250g pack streaky bacon , diced"},{"ingredients":"350g fusilli"},{"ingredients":"280g baby chestnut mushrooms , sliced"},{"ingredients":"small pack parsley , roughly chopped, to serve"},{"ingredients":"parmesan , grated, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Bring a large saucepan of salted water to the boil. Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large pan over a medium heat and fry the fennel and onion for 15 mins, or until softened. Add the garlic and chilli, and cook for 1 min, then add the tomato purée and stir for 1 min more. Toss in the bacon and fry for 5-6 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, cook the pasta according to pack instructions. Add the mushrooms to the frying pan, stir and cover for 8 mins, or until the mushrooms are soft."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Drain the pasta, adding a ladle of the cooking water to the sauce. Tip in the pasta and stir to coat. Add the rest of the oil and scatter over the parsley and Parmesan."}]

recipe: Pistachio lamb koftas with apricot relish
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 ½ tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"3 red onions , 2 1/2 thinly sliced, 1/2 grated"},{"ingredients":"400g lamb mince"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp ras el hanout"},{"ingredients":"85g pistachios , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"½ small pack flat-leaf parsley , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp good-quality apricot jam"},{"ingredients":"zest and juice 1 lemon"},{"ingredients":"2 carrots , cut into skinny matchsticks"},{"ingredients":"4 round wholemeal pitta breads , split and warmed"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp Greek-style yogurt , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put 1 1/2 tbsp olive oil in a frying pan, add most of the sliced onions with some seasoning and cook over a medium heat for about 15 mins until soft and golden."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, heat the grill to high. In a large bowl, combine the mince, grated onion, ras el hanout, most of the pistachios, half of the parsley and some seasoning. Divide the mixture into 8 and shape into patties. Place on a baking tray and brush with 1/2 tbsp oil. Grill for about 10 mins, turning once, until browned and cooked through."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Add the apricot jam, a large pinch of zest and half the lemon juice to the cooked sliced onions, bubble down until thick, then set aside. To make the salad, mix the carrots, reserved sliced onions and remaining parsley in a bowl, then toss in the remaining lemon juice and olive oil and some seasoning. To serve, spoon the apricot relish into the pittas. Then add the koftas, salad, yogurt and remaining pistachios. Alternatively, serve the pittas open with the filling piled on top."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp rapeseed oil"},{"ingredients":"3 onions, 2½ thinly sliced, ½ finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp Madras curry paste"},{"ingredients":"500g cherry tomatoes, halved"},{"ingredients":"1 red chilli, deseeded and finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"small pack coriander, roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"8 large eggs, beaten"},{"ingredients":"1 avocado, stoned, peeled and cubed"},{"ingredients":"juice 1 lemon"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a medium non-stick, ovenproof frying pan. Tip in the sliced onions and cook over a medium heat for about 10 mins until soft and golden. Add the Madras paste and fry for 1 min more, then tip in half the tomatoes and half the chilli. Cook until the mixture is thick and the tomatoes have all burst."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat the grill to high. Add half the coriander to the eggs and season, then pour over the spicy onion mixture. Stir gently once or twice, then cook over a low heat for 8-10 mins until almost set. Transfer to the grill for 3-5 mins until set."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"To make the salsa, mix the avocado, remaining chilli and tomatoes, chopped onion, remaining coriander and the lemon juice together, then season and serve with the frittata."}]

recipe: Creamy cider & sausage braise with apples & mash
name: Creamy cider & sausage braise with apples & mash

recipe: Frying pan pizza bianco with mushrooms & egg
name: Frying pan pizza bianco with mushrooms & egg

recipe: Smoked mackerel chowder with hedgehog garlic bread
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 garlic cloves , crushed"},{"ingredients":"50g butter , plus a large knob for the chowder, softened"},{"ingredients":"1 small round loaf of bread"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp vegetable oil , for cooking"},{"ingredients":"4 celery sticks, finely chopped, plus a few leaves to serve"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp plain flour"},{"ingredients":"600ml whole milk"},{"ingredients":"2 large potatoes , cut into cubes"},{"ingredients":"200g pack smoked peppered mackerel , flaked"},{"ingredients":"200g frozen sweetcorn"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7. Mash the garlic with 50g butter. Slice the bread first one way, then the other (in a hedgehog pattern), but do not cut all the way through. Stuff the crevices with garlic butter, then wrap loosely in foil, leaving the top open to crisp, and bake for 20 mins while you make the chowder."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat a knob of butter in a saucepan with the oil. Tip in the celery and onion, cook for 5 mins or until soft, then add the flour and mix to a paste. Pour in the milk, a little at a time, and cook until smooth and the consistency of double cream. Add the potatoes and half the mackerel, cover and simmer for 15 mins until the potatoes are cooked."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Flake the remaining mackerel, add to the chowder with the sweetcorn and simmer for 1-2 mins until the sweetcorn is cooked. Splash in a little water if it is too thick. Ladle into bowls, scatter over the celery leaves and serve with the bread for dunking."}]

recipe: Jacket potato with whipped feta & sumac
name: Jacket potato with whipped feta & sumac

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 large onion , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 thumb-sized piece ginger , peeled and grated"},{"ingredients":"2 large garlic cloves"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp rapeseed oil"},{"ingredients":"2-3 tbsp tikka curry paste"},{"ingredients":"400g can chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp tomato purée"},{"ingredients":"½ tbsp light brown soft sugar"},{"ingredients":"3 cardamom pods , bashed"},{"ingredients":"200g brown basmati rice"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp ground almonds"},{"ingredients":"300g raw king prawns"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp double cream"},{"ingredients":"½ bunch of coriander , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"naan breads , warmed, to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the onion, ginger and garlic in a food processor and blitz to a smooth paste. Heat the oil in a large flameproof casserole dish or pan over a medium heat. Add the onion paste and fry for 8 mins or until lightly golden. Stir in the curry paste and fry for 1 min more. Add the tomatoes, tomato purée, sugar and cardamom pods. Bring to a simmer and cook, covered, for another 10 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Cook the rice following pack instructions."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Scoop the cardamom out of the curry sauce and discard, then blitz with a hand blender, or in a clean food processor. Return to the pan, add the almonds and prawns, and cook for 5 mins. Season to taste and stir through the cream and coriander. Serve with the rice and naan breads, if you like."}]

recipe: Crispy cod fingers with wedges & dill slaw
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 large sweet potatoes (700g), scrubbed and cut into wedges"},{"ingredients":"½ tbsp sunflower oil , plus a little extra"},{"ingredients":"¼ large red cabbage"},{"ingredients":"½ medium red onion , finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"6 large cornichons , quartered"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp Greek yogurt or mayonnaise"},{"ingredients":"25g dill , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"4 skinned  cod fillets (160g per fillet)"},{"ingredients":"2 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"100g fresh breadcrumbs"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. In a bowl, toss the wedges with the oil, 1 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp pepper. Transfer to a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 mins, turning halfway through. The wedges should be crisp and golden brown."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, make the slaw. Remove the cabbage’s white core and discard. Slice the leaves as finely as possible and put in a large mixing bowl with the onion and cornichons. In another bowl, combine the yogurt or mayonnaise with the dill and 2 tbsp of the cornichons’ pickling liquid. Mix the dressing with the other slaw ingredients until everything is well coated, then set aside."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat grill to high. Slice each cod fillet into two or three fingers. Beat the eggs lightly in a shallow bowl and tip the breadcrumbs into a separate bowl with a good pinch of salt and pepper. Dip each cod finger in the egg and then in the breadcrumbs, and place on an oiled baking sheet. Grill for 6-7 mins or until cooked through and golden. Serve with the crispy wedges and a generous helping of the dill pickle slaw."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 large garlic cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"¼ tsp chilli flakes"},{"ingredients":"2 rosemary sprigs, leaves finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 x 400g cans chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp brown sugar"},{"ingredients":"6 pork sausages"},{"ingredients":"150ml whole milk"},{"ingredients":"1 lemon, zested"},{"ingredients":"350g rigatoni pasta"},{"ingredients":"grated parmesan and ½ small bunch parsley, leaves roughly chopped, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat 2 tbsp of the oil in a saucepan over a medium heat. Fry the onion with a pinch of salt for 7 mins. Add the garlic, chilli and rosemary, and cook for 1 min more. Tip in the tomatoes and sugar, and simmer for 20 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat the remaining oil in a medium frying pan over a medium heat. Squeeze the sausagemeat from the skins and fry, breaking it up with a wooden spoon, for 5-7 mins until golden. Add to the sauce with the milk and lemon zest, then simmer for a further 5 mins. To freeze, leave to cool completely and transfer to large freezerproof bags."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Cook the pasta following pack instructions. Drain and toss with the sauce. Scatter over the parmesan and parsley leaves to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 tbsp plain flour"},{"ingredients":"2 aubergines , sliced into 0.5cm discs"},{"ingredients":"100g dried breadcrumbs (see tip, below left, for how to make your own to save money)"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"250g basmati rice"},{"ingredients":"1 large onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"4 garlic cloves , crushed"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp curry powder"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp clear honey"},{"ingredients":"400ml can coconut milk"},{"ingredients":"1 large cucumber"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"In a large bowl, combine 3 tbsp flour and enough water to make a runny paste, then season and add the aubergines, tossing until they are all coated. Tip the breadcrumbs onto a plate and dip in each aubergine slice, turning to coat and pressing down to help the crumbs stick."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Heat a drizzle of oil in a frying pan. Cook the aubergine slices in batches for 5 mins each side or until tender, adding a little more oil between batches. Transfer the slices to a baking tray as you go. Once all the aubergine slices are browned, place the tray in the oven and cook for 10-15 mins while you make the sauce. Cook the rice following pack instructions."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Wipe out the pan and heat another drizzle of oil. Add the onion and cook for a few mins to soften. Stir in the garlic and curry powder for 1 min, then add the remaining 1 tbsp flour and the honey, and stir to a paste. Splash in the coconut milk, a little at a time, stirring to make a smooth sauce, then simmer over a low heat for 10 mins, adding a splash of water if it gets too thick. Peel the cucumber into long strips with a peeler. Drain the rice and serve with the crispy aubergine slices, curry sauce and cucumber ribbons."}]

recipe: Sweet potato & sprout hash with poached eggs
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 large sweet potatoes , cut into chunks"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 red onions , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"300g Brussels sprouts , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"grating of nutmeg"},{"ingredients":"3 eggs"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the sweet potatoes in a bowl, cover with cling film and microwave on high for 5 mins until tender but still holding their shape. Uncover the bowl and leave to cool a little."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, heat the oil in a wide non-stick frying pan and add the onions. Cook for 5-8 mins until starting to caramelise. Add the sprouts and stir-fry over a high heat until softened. Push the sprouts and onions to one side of the pan and add the sweet potatoes, squashing them down in the pan with the back of a spatula. Leave undisturbed for 5 mins until starting to crisp on the underside. Season, add the nutmeg, mix in the sprouts and onions, and flip the potato over, trying not to break it up too much. Cook for a further 5 mins until really crispy."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Meanwhile, poach 3 eggs in a pan of barely simmering water. Serve the hash topped with poached eggs."}]

recipe: Sticky chicken drumsticks & sesame rice salad
name: Sticky chicken drumsticks & sesame rice salad

recipe: Chicken & cider fricassée with parsley croûtes
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 whole chickens (1.5kg-2kg each), each jointed into 8 pieces, or 16 bone-in chicken pieces)"},{"ingredients":"300g smoked  streaky bacon , chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 onions , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 carrots , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 celery stalks, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"500g pack  chestnut mushroom , quartered"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp plain flour"},{"ingredients":"500ml bottle dry cider"},{"ingredients":"1 ½l chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"5 sprigs thyme"},{"ingredients":"2 bay leaves"},{"ingredients":"150ml double cream"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp English mustard"},{"ingredients":"small pack  tarragon leaves, chopped"},{"ingredients":"large pack curly parsley , leaves very finely chopped, stalks reserved for the chicken"},{"ingredients":"100ml olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 baguette , sliced into rounds"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in your largest flameproof casserole or deep pan. Season the chicken and brown in batches. Transfer to a plate. Reduce the heat and add the bacon to the pan. Fry until golden and crisp, then set aside with the chicken. Add the onions, carrots, and celery to the pan, scraping up any browned bits with a wooden spoon. Fry over a low heat until soft and starting to brown."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the mushrooms and continue to cook for a further 4-5 mins. Stir in the flour until it disappears, then stir in the cider and stock and bring to the boil, scraping any bits stuck to the bottom of the pan. At this stage, if you haven’t got enough room to add back all the chicken and bacon, split the sauce between two pans."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Tie the thyme, parsley stalks (from amount used for croûtes) and bay leaves together with kitchen string (in two bunches if you’ve had to split the sauce) and add to the casserole along with the chicken and bacon. Bring to a simmer. Cover and cook for 1 hr 15 mins until the chicken is tender and coming away from the bone."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Carefully lift out the cooked chicken and cover with foil to keep warm. Discard the herbs. Turn up the heat and simmer the remaining liquid until reduced by about half."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Meanwhile, make the croûtes. Heat oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7. In a small bowl, mix together the parsley leaves, oil and plenty of salt and pepper. Dip one side of each baguette slice into the mixture to coat, then place, herb-side up, on a baking tray and bake until golden, about 15-20 mins."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Add the cream, mustard and tarragon to the sauce and season to taste. Return the chicken to the casserole and warm through. Serve with the croûtes and your favourite seasonal vegetables."}]
